thread.title_full: Fan has a ball meeting Tom Brady | Boston Herald

author: Owen Boss
title: Fan has a ball meeting Tom Brady
text:
He may not have ended up with the football Tom Brady threw for his 400th career touchdown pass, but lifelong Patriots fan David Bowen of Plymouth, who graciously returned the ball after it was handed to him in Sunday’s rout of the Jacksonville Jaguars, got to meet the star quarterback face-to-face at Gillette Stadium yesterday.
“He was very generous, he was very nice to us,” Bowen said. “It was overwhelming, it’s something I’ll remember forever.”
Bowen, a season ticket-holder since 1985, said soon after he was presented with the ball in the stands by Danny Amendola following the wide receiver’s 1-yard TD catch, a Pats ball boy ran over and asked him if he would be willing to swap it for another game ball.
“I said, ‘Sure, no problem,’ and they just gave me another one,” Bowen said.
And now, thanks to Bowen, Brady’s “400 ball” is on display in The Hall at Patriot Place. In its place, Bowen was given the chance to meet his favorite player.
“He signed some stuff for me and thanked me for returning the ball,” Bowen said. “I got to congratulate an icon on this amazing accomplishment and what he’s done. It was great.”
Bowen said he and a few friends met Brady after practice. Brady posed for pictures with the group and signed a few items, including footballs, helmets and photos.
